intro: Holmgrenia, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plants typically have palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Holmgrenia species are often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. They play an important role in the ecological and cultural heritage of Hawaii.
